text: It was great welcoming @NRECANews' CEO Jim Matheson as a guest at our Board of Directors meeting yesterday in Washington, D.C. Jim is pictured here with Board member Roger Kline, GM & CEO of Northern Wasco County PUD, and @CEOPublicPower Scott Corwin. https://t.co/sbSIwchXun

APPA's 2026 Legislative Rally has officially begun at The Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. Participants include #PublicPower utilities, joint action agencies, and state associations from across the country. The event kicked off with our Policy Deep Dive sessions, where industry experts provided in-depth insights into the policies shaping the future of public power. A special thanks to Meguire Whitney for sponsoring our Deep Dive session on "Reactors, Regulations, and Returns: Nuclear Policy and Tax Incentives." Subsequent sessions addressed topics such as the federal tax landscape and the importance of utility visits in legislative advocacy.

APPA's new resource, "What Public Power Needs to Know About Serving Data Centers," explains the opportunities and challenges presented by the rapid growth in load demand driven by data centers for electric utilities that serve these customers. The report provides an overview of the market context and background information on data centers. It also outlines key considerations and strategies for serving data center customers, along with examples of how public power utilities are collaborating with both prospective and current data center customers.

‚¨áÔ∏èDownload the full report here: https://t.co/srNMGzXPZF

Effective January 1, the city of Lake Worth, Fla., has entered into an agreement with @FMPAnews‚Äô All-Requirements Power Supply Project. Under the agreement, the ARP will supply Lake Worth‚Äôs wholesale power needs above its firm resources through December 31, 2032. https://t.co/DehYZPAQx2

#PublicPower is honoring #BlackHistoryMonth with a tribute to Lewis Latimer (1848‚Äì1928), an electrical pioneer known for his numerous inventions, which included an evaporative air conditioner and an innovative process for manufacturing carbon filaments for incandescent light bulbs. The son of fugitive slaves, Latimer had no access to formal education but taught himself mechanical drawing while serving in the U.S. Navy. He went on to become a chief draftsman, patent expert, and inventor. Throughout his career, he collaborated with other scientific pioneers, including Alexander Graham Bell, Hiram Maxim, and Thomas Edison. 

‚ú®To learn more, you can purchase the book "Lewis Latimer: The First Hidden Figure" by Steve Mitnick from Public Utilities Fortnightly, available in our online store: https://t.co/AKoxMPPx5Y.

Texas #PublicPower utility @austinenergy recently energized a new substation to add energy capacity for rapidly growing parts of North Austin, Texas. The new Kramer Substation will increase reliability to existing circuits in that area and eventually feed a new mixed-use development in North Austin. https://t.co/AzGxJG39zL
